newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albania ties environment clauses to oil deals.
newsitem.headline: Albania ties environment clauses to oil deals.

text.p: Albania's energy and mining ministry admitted on Wednesday the country's oil sector was to blame for severe pollution but said the government had now started to oblige companies to better protect the environment.
"It is true that there is a severe pollution of the environment by the oil sector," Energy and Mining Minister Abdyl Xhaja told a news conference.
"Efforts have focused on extracting oil and little attention has been given to the environment."
Xhaja said the government was including the protection and rehabilitation of the natural environment as one of the basic conditions in all new exploration contracts.
"In all the contracts we are signing one of the fundamental conditions is the protection of the environment," he said.
He added that in the Patos-Marinez oilfield alone, operated jointly by Albania's state-owned Albpetrol and Britain's Premier Oil Plc, $2 million were spent every year on environmental protection.
